Art. 4.30. 
Simple collaterals 
Simple collaterals are not called to the succession if the deceased leaves a surviving spouse.
 If there are ascendants only in one line, the half referred to the simple collaterals of the other line devolves to the nearest of them.
 If there are no ascendants in either line, the succession devolves to the simple collaterals, in each of the two lines to the one who is closest in degree in that line.   If, in the same line, there is a concurrence of simple collaterals to the same degree, they succeed by head, unless they are called by substitution, insofar as the substitution is authorised.
